meanings.definition: Perceptions that appear real but are created by the mind
meanings.sent1: Sometimes, people with schizophrenia experience hallucinations, seeing things that others cannot see.
meanings.sent2: The patient described vivid hallucinations of colorful butterflies fluttering around the room.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor's hallucinations of talking animals made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her hallucinations of a ghostly figure lurking in the shadows added an eerie atmosphere to the story.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the hallucinations of a dreamlike world with floating islands and strange creatures.

meanings.sent1: The drug caused hallucinations, making the user feel sensations that were not real.
meanings.sent2: She was terrified by the hallucinations of spiders crawling on her skin.
meanings.sent3: The children's game of pretending to have magical powers led to hilarious hallucinations of flying broomsticks.
meanings.sent4: The old house was filled with echoes, creating auditory hallucinations of ghostly whispers.
meanings.sent5: The virtual reality game induced hallucinations of flying through space, tricking the senses into believing the experience was real.

meanings.sent1: His hallucinations of being a superhero led him to believe he could fly off the roof.
meanings.sent2: The cult leader's manipulative tactics caused his followers to have shared hallucinations of impending doom.
meanings.sent3: The politician's hallucinations of being loved by all voters made him overconfident in the election.
meanings.sent4: The conspiracy theorist's hallucinations of government surveillance fueled his paranoia.
meanings.sent5: In the dream, her hallucinations of being a famous actress felt so real that she woke up expecting paparazzi outside her door.
